DOC.brief_summary: This observational study, conducted by the Kenya Society for Hematology and Oncology, will develop a Breast Cancer and Care Registry (BRECC) for Kenya. Data on demographic, clinical and pathological characteristics, treatment and clinical outcome will be collected from newly diagnosed breast cancer patients. Breast cancer patients will be recruited into this registry cohort and followed up for a period of not less than five years.
DOC.brief_title: An Observational Study to Register the Incidence of Breast Cancer and Current Clinical Care Patterns in Kenya
DOC.criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed breast cancer No previous interventional therapy for breast cancer Ability to provide written informed consent as per GCP and local regulations Participation in other clinical study where the diagnosis and treatment protocol is stated prior to enrolment Inability to assess and follow up patient outcomes, for example quality of life due to psychiatric illness or WHO/ECOG performance status IV or worse
